pageContext.claim: “I recently signed legislation that includes more than $2 billion to improve school safety, including the funding for training, and metal detectors, and security, and mental health.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a bogus figure. The administration counts $1.7 billion, which is obviously less than $2 billion. But even that is misleading. More than 60 percent of the money comes from a pot that is mostly devoted to a well-rounded education or technology, not school safety — and it’s an Obama-era program the administration wanted to zero out.
